data.text:
@JohnCornyn @WSJopinion John, probably the worst move possible. Take money meant for public schools and redistribute to the wealthy. Show me stats where over half are families that didn’t already have kids in private school. I’ll wait.

Redistribution of wealth at the expense of public education.

@JohnCornyn @WSJopinion Well John……..most Texas Taxpayers don’t even have school age kids.  Why would any Texan want to fund public schools and then turn around and Subsidize private schools?? Sounds like a lot of Bamboozling going on.

@JohnCornyn @WSJopinion What percentage of applicants already have their kids in private school? This isn’t an investment. It’s using public funds to benefit affluent people who were getting by without it - at the expense of our public school system. What a scam.

@geo_b42 @JohnCornyn @WSJopinion I was against school vouchers but STOP with the ‘religious indoctrination’ line…..

…..that ain’t it….
@JohnCornyn @WSJopinion Rich people like free money? Stop the presses!
